patterns: Which API can use to retreive data from TREP

responses: You can use Elektron SDK or TREP APIs such as RFA to retrieve, publish and contribute data. See more details from https://developers.refinitiv.com/thomson-reuters-enterprise-platform/apis-in-this-family, there is download section in each API.Note that only RDC named user can access TREP API download page.

EMA(C++/Java) and RFA(C++/.NET/Java) can consuming and publishing data to TREP. You can use ESDK to contribute data to TRCC. patterns: On what scenarios one should Prefer ETA over EMA?
Should I use EMA or EMA?
responses: ETA is targeted for applications that need very high throughput with the lowest latency we offer. In addition, it exposes a wide array of tuning options so you have the ability to control your network layer down to the last detail. EMA is still quite performant but defaults many configuration options and provides more ease of use for rapid onboarding and a more intuitive user experience. If you are finding that EMA is able to handle your use case it sounds like you are at the right layer!

patterns: difference between API products: RFA vs ETA vs EMA vs UPA
Can you compare EMA and ETA
Can you compare RFA and EMA?
responses:
As for differences, in summary:
RFA is our legacy feature complete API
UPA has now been re-branded as Elektron Transport API (ETA)
ETA is our lowest level highest performance strategic API
Elektron Message API is a higher level strategic API which is easier to use whilst still offering a high level of performance.
For most developers EMA is the recommend API for any new development or rewrite of existing applications. The performance should be more than adequate for the majority of use case scenarios.It is much easier to learn, less code is required to implement functionality and therefore also easier to maintain long term.
For those requiring the highest level of performance e.g. algorithmic trading - they should consider ETA.
For a high level overview of EMA please refer them to article Introduction to Elektron Message API(https://developers.refinitiv.com/article/introduction-elektron-message-api) as well as the Elektron SDK page https://developers.thomsonreuters.com/elektron.
You can find details regarding Elektron SDK from https://developers.refinitiv.com/elektron/apis-in-this-family
Find more details from https://developers.refinitiv.com/elektron/apis-in-this-family

Can I use EMA on RHEL7
Can I use EMA on Linux?
Can I use Elektron SDK on Linux
Can I use ESDK on Windows
Can I use EMA with gcc 4.x
responses: You can use TREP API (RFA,OpenDACS,etc) and Elektron SDK(EMA/ETA) on Windows and Linux. Anyway please find supported OS and Compiler from API Compatibility Matrix https://developers.refinitiv.com/elektron/elektron-sdk-cc/docs?content=5403&type=documentation_item

patterns: Where can I download ESDK for .NET?
responses: Currently Elektron SDK(ESDK) does not support .NET. Only C++ and Java version available on https://github.com/Refinitiv/Elektron-SDK or https://developers.refinitiv.com/elektron/apis-in-this-family

ESDK does not support .NET. The Elektron Websocket API seems to be the only one which can support .NET as it is language agnostic. There are code samples in most programming language, including .NET and Python.
